intro: Helia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered helia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
